bibl.title: Family Papers from Tebtunis. Unfolding a Bundle of Papyri.
The Two Faces of Graeco-Roman Egypt. Greek and Demotic and Greek-Demotic Texts and Studies Presented to P.W. Pestman
bibl.author: VERHOOGT, Arthur M.F.W.

bibl.note: The bundle of papyri found by B.P. Grenfell and A.S. Hunt in Tebtynis during the winter of 1899/1900 probably contains a small portion of the family papers (from about 165 A.D. to 266/7 A.D.) of Aurelia Sarapias, Antinoite landowner in the Fayum.
VERHOOGT Arthur M.F.W., Family Papers from Tebtunis. Unfolding a Bundle of Papyri.

A.M.F.W. VERHOOGT and S.P. VLEEMING (Edd.), The Two Faces of Graeco-Roman Egypt. Greek and Demotic and Greek-Demotic Texts and Studies Presented to P.W. Pestman = Papyrologica Lugduno-Batava. XXX (Leiden, 1998) pp. 141-154, 2 tabl., 2 arbres généal.
